bio:treatment.description: Plants medium-sized. Stems 3–5 cm, regularly to irregularly pinnate, branches 0.3–0.7 cm. Stem leaves ovate, plicate, 1.1–1.8 mm; margins strongly revolute to near apex; costa double, distinct; medial laminal cells 30–40 × 4–5 µm.
Open sites, earth, rock faces, epiphytic on tree bases, logs in forests, commonly calcicole but not confined to calcareous substrates;

Greenland; Alta., B.C., Man., Nfld. and Labr., N.W.T., N.S., Nunavut, Ont., Que., Sask., Yukon; Alaska, Ariz., Calif., Colo., Idaho, Mont., Nev., N.Mex., Oreg., S.Dak., Tex., Utah, Wash., Wyo.; s South America; Europe; Asia; Antarctica.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety revolutum produces sporophytes in summer.
